Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
Level Description: Advanced (complete and accurate representation of all elements)
CAN: The student can accurately depict healthy, thriving plants with adequate water and light, showing bright colors, strong stems, and lush foliage.
The student can draw plants lacking water, showing wilted leaves, drooping stems, or dry soil to represent poor growth conditions.
The student can illustrate plants deprived of light with signs of weak or stunted growth, possibly depicting spindly stems or pale leaves.
The student can effectively demonstrate through their drawings that all living plants require both water and light for survival, using clear visual distinctions.
The student can use patterns, such as different shading or coloration, to highlight the differences between conditions of adequacy and deficiency in water and light.
CANNOT: The student may occasionally omit minor details, such as forgetting to label every part of the drawing, but these do not impact the overall understanding.
The student might occasionally use inconsistent scaling or sizing in their drawings, which can slightly affect the visual impression but not the conceptual representation.
